intro: Conyza portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Conyza portoricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
